confirmation.message: Are you sure? This action cannot be undone.
confirmation.title: Confirmation

task.free-space: This task is your free space. This was the original task for this space.
task.title: Task Information

annoying-lobbies.comment: Don't you hate that one player that wants a theme that nobody else wants?
annoying-lobbies.description: Somebody in the lobby requests a theme, and usually it's one that nobody else wants (i.e. cat theme).

annoying-lobbies.comment: TIP: Players who cooperate with their team win more games.
annoying-lobbies.description: A player (most likely a townie) calls the town stupid (probably because they're about to be lynched).

annoying-lobbies.comment: TIP: Randomly lynching a player favors the evil roles.
annoying-lobbies.description: Someone gets lynched with no evidence, despite having a claim.

annoying-lobbies.comment: There's a reason new players stick to classic.
annoying-lobbies.description: Someone, probably because they claimed being new, gets told by someone, probably a more veteran player, to go play classic.
annoying-lobbies.display-text: Someone gets told to go back to classic

annoying-lobbies.comment: Actually, I'm over here making a 30,000 iQ jest play, thanks.
annoying-lobbies.description: Someone gets accused of throwing. For example, if they claim red vigilante as solo mafioso.

annoying-lobbies.comment: Listen, I don't like framer either, but I still play it out.
annoying-lobbies.description: 3 or more players disconnect (doesn't have to be all at once). Usually, this will happen on day 1 if it's a crap role, or on the stand if they rage quit.
annoying-lobbies.display-text: 3 or more suicides in a single game

annoying-lobbies.comment: Mafia was roleblocked or hit an immune.
annoying-lobbies.description: A night passes and nobody dies. Usually there will be like 3 people roleblocked, 1 jailed, and 1 pirated; or mafia hit an immune.

annoying-lobbies.comment: Stop ordering pizza as soon as you sit down to play Town of Salem.
annoying-lobbies.description: One of the mafia members is AFK. Usually, when another mafia member gets lynched, they'll make sure town knows.

annoying-lobbies.comment: Thanks for blowing my jest cover...jeez.
annoying-lobbies.description: Somebody in the town get called an idiot by someone else. This will almost certainly happen if the jailor doesn't jail who town wants jailed.
annoying-lobbies.display-text: Someone calls someone else an idiot

annoying-lobbies.description: A confirmed executioner lives for a surprisingly long time. They probably pushed a townie in a 1 for 1, and town forgot about them; or evils have majority.
annoying-lobbies.display-text: Confirmed exe lives for a long time

annoying-lobbies.comment: Why? Doctor is such an easy role.
annoying-lobbies.description: Somebody with a town role disconnects on day 1, and they're almost certainly something useful like spy, investigator, or jailor.

annoying-lobbies.comment: Well, I guess that player is dead now.
annoying-lobbies.description: The investigator finds someone that has the correct results to be mayor or jailor. A smart investigator would whisper the jailor and post fake results.

mistakes.comment: TIP: Wills are a powerful tool, use them to your advantage.
mistakes.description: A townie that dies either has a blank will, or they didn't update their will to say where they went. Inevitably, they visited the werewolf.

mistakes.comment: Careful with that thing, you'll shoot your eye out...oh...nevermind.
mistakes.description: A vigilante shoot a town member at night. You'll find out tomorrow why this is bad. This usually happens when vigilantes shoot without asking for role.

mistakes.comment: Well, I guess they won't be making that mistake again this game.
mistakes.description: The jailor executes a town member at night. Probably because the jailor didn't ask for a claim, or didn't like their claim.

mistakes.comment: You know that's a reportable offense, right?
mistakes.description: Someone throws the game. There are many ways this can happen: a town member could ignore town investigatives, an evil could give up their team while getting lynched, among others. A solo evil claiming doesn't count as a throw.

mistakes.comment: Well, hotshot, now they know for sure there is an arsonist. Good job.
mistakes.description: An arsonist ignites their doused targets on night 2. This is bad for the arsonist because it starts the arsonist hunt.

mistakes.comment: Why? You know what has to happen now.
mistakes.description: Vigilante openly claims in a coven leader game. This is a problem because the coven leader can use the vigilante against the town. Claiming TK doesn't count.
mistakes.display-text: Vigilante claims in a coven leader game

mistakes.comment: You had 1 job...just 1 job...and you failed.
mistakes.description: A veteran dies on night 1, whether or not they baited.
mistakes.display-text: Veteran doesn't alert night 1 and dies

mistakes.comment: Seriously? You fell for that? lmao
mistakes.description: A member of the mafia falls for a vet bait, and dies to the veteran. The one they usually fall for is "vet bait".

mistakes.comment: I don't think that's what they meant by eye for an eye.
mistakes.description: A mafia member dies to coven and a coven member dies to mafia in the same night.
The first thing someone says when they get voted up is "why me?".

mistakes.comment: You did get the Werewolf lynched, but doesn't this count as a throw?
mistakes.description: Someone evil reveals their role, just to get a target lynched. Like a blackmailer revealing because the werewolf is whispering the survivor or their guardian angel.
mistakes.display-text: Evil reveals to get someone lynched

mistakes.comment: You're still not a vigilante. Don't kid yourself.
mistakes.description: Someone says they are a [insert color] vigilante, such as mafioso claiming red vigilante, serial killer claiming blue vigilante, or juggernaut claiming salmon vigilante.

mistakes.comment: You can LISTEN to other's conversations. Replies not advised.
mistakes.description: A blackmailer responds to a whisper that was not sent to them. For example, a guardian angel asks for their targets role and the blackmailer replies.

obvious-plays.comment: I get that it's in your invest results, but be original man.
obvious-plays.description: When voted up, the mafioso claims vigilante. They do this because the investigator results for mafioso contain vigilante.
The jester makes a super obvious play, like claiming an evil role. Town will sometimes pity guilty the jest.

obvious-plays.comment: That's one dead mayor, or they're making a power play. Probably the former.
obvious-plays.description: The mayor reveals. This could be good or bad. Sometimes the mayor is the dumbest member of the town.

obvious-plays.comment: That dead person? My target obviously went there last night...obviously.
obvious-plays.description: The executioner makes a super obvious play, such as tracking their target to a dead person.

obvious-plays.comment: Gee, I wonder why this guy is immune?
obvious-plays.description: The Godfather claims executioner as their role when voted up. This is because the executioner is immune and so is the Godfather.
The arsonist claims executioner as their role when voted up. Much like the Godfather, this is because executioner is immune.

obvious-plays.comment: You, my good sir, are the exact opposite of a doctor.
obvious-plays.description: The arsonist claims doctor, since it's the only town role in their investigator results.

obvious-plays.comment: Let's be real, the mafia is getting lynched.
obvious-plays.description: When the game gets down to the last few players, there will usually be a role call to determine everyone's actual roles and decide who's going to win.

obvious-plays.comment: So much for my stealth vamp takeover.
obvious-plays.description: A town member calls for, or starts, a vote for role. Usually, a confirmed town member, such as a veteran.

obvious-plays.comment: Just because I saw you visit the medium, SK, doesn't make me an exe.
obvious-plays.description: Someone, usually with incriminating results, gets called an executioner by the evil they are trying to get voted up.
Someone asks for a town protective or a lookout on them. This is a common Medusa bait.

obvious-plays.comment: This is why survs get insta-lynched
obvious-plays.description: Someone in a role that has defense claims survivor. This is because survivors also have defense on nights that they put on a bulletproof vest.

wins.comment: Let's be honest, it was a hex bomb. The hex master won.
Some people just wanna watch the world burn.
Wait, you mean that doctor claim actually worked?
How the heck did that happen?
It's not a loss, so it counts as a win here!
Not gonna lie, I'm actually kind of impressed.
You're lying, you didn't see that end screen. Play fair.
